item.title: judith ~ jlo add a quote by Émile Zola
item.description: "If you ask me what I came to do in this world, I, an artist, will answer you: I am here to live out loud." -- Émile Zola

item.title: judith ~ jlo add a quote by Roy Blount Jr.
item.description: "An author is a person who can never take innocent pleasure in visiting a bookstore again. Say you go in and discover that there are no copies of your book on the shelves. You resent all the other books - I don't care if they are Great Expectations, Life on the Mississippi and the King James Bible that are on the shelves." -- Roy Blount Jr.

item.title: judith ~ jlo add a quote by E.M. Forster
item.description: "I suggest that the only books that influence us are those for which we are ready, and which have gone a little further down our particular path than we have yet gone ourselves." -- E.M. Forster

item.title: judith ~ jlo add a quote by George Bernard Shaw
item.description: "I finished my first book seventy-six years ago. I offered it to every publisher on the English-speaking earth I had ever heard of. Their refusals were unanimous: and it did not get into print until, fifty years later; publishers would publish anything that had my name on it." -- George Bernard Shaw

item.title: judith ~ jlo add a quote by Ralph Waldo Emerson
item.description: "There are books . . . which rank in our life with parents and lovers and passionate experiences." -- Ralph Waldo Emerson

item.title: judith ~ jlo add a quote by Joyce Carol Oates
item.description: "Reading is the sole means by which we slip, involuntarily, often helplessly, into another's skin, another's voice, another's soul." -- Joyce Carol Oates

item.title: judith ~ jlo add a quote by P. J. O'Rourke
item.description: "Always read stuff that will make you look good if you die in the middle of it." -- P. J. O'Rourke
